posts.post_content:
@thelittleupsman: You're fairly right. It's actually a *green* [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning), but yes. This is a so called "planeshifted" version of it - different color, same stats. This is also the reason for the different design God\_of\_Slivers wondered about, which is used to make it more discernable.   
  
I really like that one, and i think True\_Mumin's theory is likely to be right.

I really like that one, and i think True_Mumin's theory is likely to be right.

posts.post_content:
This was actually a finisher in what I hear was an excellent mono-green aggro deck back when it was Type-II legal. Considering green's ability to accelerate and pump-up creatures, I think this would be more terrifying to face than [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning). Let's just say I would NOT want to see this coming at me on turn two, or at any time when a [Primal Forcemage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primal Forcemage) is in play.  
  
@Xycolian: Nice.

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (11/4/2012 8:24:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Next to green creature pump ([Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth), ect) this card seems significantly more terrifying than Ball Lightning. On top of that green has the ability to pump out multiples of these a bit too quickly thanks to all the ramp, as well as with [Green Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Green Sun's Zenith ) .  
  
Of course, Ball Lightning has the advantage of being [fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fling)-able while remaining in color. But why not just run both? For real, a play set of both will make an opponent cringe when *every turn* they're getting hit with a 6/1 trample haste, starting turn 2 with a [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise).
posts.html:
Next to green creature pump (Giant Growth, ect) this card seems significantly more terrifying than Ball Lightning. On top of that green has the ability to pump out multiples of these a bit too quickly thanks to all the ramp, as well as with Green Sun's Zenith .

Of course, Ball Lightning has the advantage of being fling-able while remaining in color. But why not just run both? For real, a play set of both will make an opponent cringe when every turn they're getting hit with a 6/1 trample haste, starting turn 2 with a Birds of Paradise.

Posted By: BongRipper420 (7/6/2012 6:13:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I love this thing. look closely at the art and you'll notice a guy being thrown off into the sky by it. to me the big advantage here is that I can play some of each in ![Red or Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=RG&type=symbol) decks. However, to those who say that this is better than ball lighting because of green's mana acceleration? [Desperate Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Desperate Ritual), [Geosurge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geosurge), [Infernal Plunge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infernal Plunge), [Pyretic Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyretic Ritual), [Rite of Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Flame) and [Seething Song](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seething Song) beg to differ. Green has ramp, but red has rituals. This is one that I honestly think works better in red, but it's still hella fun in green, so it gets my vote of approval!
posts.html:
I love this thing. look closely at the art and you'll notice a guy being thrown off into the sky by it. to me the big advantage here is that I can play some of each in decks. However, to those who say that this is better than ball lighting because of green's mana acceleration? Desperate Ritual, Geosurge, Infernal Plunge, Pyretic Ritual, Rite of Flame and Seething Song beg to differ. Green has ramp, but red has rituals. This is one that I honestly think works better in red, but it's still hella fun in green, so it gets my vote of approval!
